fxInfo_label: Chief executive appointment by upper chamber implicit approval
fxInfo_citation: V-Dem Codebook (see suggested citation at the top of this document).
fxInfo_clarification: The chief executive is defined by whether the head of state or the head of government have more relative power (v2ex_hosw, v2x_hogw). Answer v2exapupap only if the legislature is playing a role in the appointment of the chief executive (if v2exaphos or v2exaphogp are 1).
fxInfo_question: Is the tacit or implicit approval of the upper chamber (alongside the lower chamber) necessary for the appointment of the chief executive?
fxInfo_sources: National constitutions; Websites of national governments.
name: v2exapupap
